7.23.19  9:15 pm   I've got some songs I wrote on guitar and I want to record them to record more of my music, but I feel stuck unless I'm playing on my guitar. Is it better to record the guitar and build from there or try to lay a groundwork and then overdub it for stable rhythm?

      it's going to be a very different activity, playing/singing as a 1 person live performer (guitar), vs. designing an arrangement. both processes can be very rewarding, but they're totally different. if you're doing an arrangement i would not recommend starting with your normal solo guitar performance. if you're working alone, i would strongly recommend using a click and doing percussion first. then do temp instruments, then temp vocal, then go back and re-build the instrumental arrangement, then finally re-do the vocal, then maybe touch up the instruments then maybe touch up the vocal. where as, on the other hand, if you'd rather capture the solo singer-songwriter/guitar performance, i would suggest capturing as much room noise as you can

7.23.19  7:48 pm   What is the name of this chord?

A#/Bb - C - E?

      sounds like C7. if the bass is on C then you can call it C7. if the bass is on F#, you can call it F#7b5. if the bass is on Ab, you can call it Abaug(add2). if the bass is on F, you can call if Fsus4maj7. if the bass is on B, you can give the charts back to the arranger with some constructive feedback

7.23.19  6:19 pm   after quite some time of not knowing what to draw, an idea finally popped into my head last night!!!! I'm working on the drawing right now yayyyy!!!!!!!!
I've decided to try my best to make the drawing look different from my past drawings. It just NEEDS to be different, I mean, I haven't done anything in weeks! The problem that I'm currently facing is the idea that the drawing won't be worth the wait.. My audience is waiting for me to post something good, but what if the drawing doesn't end up meeting their expectations? What if the drawing ends up looking the same as my past ones despite my efforts to make it look different and unique?
Do you ever worry about this kind of stuff?

     yes

      If so, how do you cope with these negative thoughts and worries?

     fake my own death

      Do you simply ignore the thoughts and just hope for the best? Or do you do something else?

      you could try exploring some entirely new mediums, and platforms, where you might have much less experience, forcing you to think outside the box and also should appear much different especially because you don't know how to do any of the things you always did before

7.23.19  1:07 am   do people conceptualize time via numbers?

     yes

      do we require labels such as months and years and seconds to be able to define and understand the concept of time?

     it helps

      what is time if you eliminate outside stimuli from which to gauge it?

     nothing

      is it possible for us to understand time with no clocks, no sun moving through the sky, no seasons?

     not without something that can be used as a clock. and almost anything that moves can be used as a clock

      this shit really starts to make no sense when you consider relativity...like how do you explain the concept of time moving faster for someone in a spaceship to your dog, which has no real idea of some grand unifying force tying different actions and memories together?

     that is a huge glaring problem with almost every attempted explaination of time dilation i have ever seen

      sorry i doubt you are particularly interested in this.

     i am highly interested in it

      i will refrain from submitting more questions of the sort for at least another two weeks or so

7.22.19  6:28 pm   hey quick question, if i have a chord with a number, say f11,

     that's a weird example which has problems

      do i just add the fourth  note in the scale to the major triad? if so what is the difference between an 11 and a 4?
thanks

      it's less about rules than you may think. it's like spelling. it's developed over time and there are some exceptions that don't make too much logical sense but that's how it's evolved. i will go through all the numbers and see if i can explain what each one probably means.
     F1 probably a race car
     F2 you might occasionally see this as an abbreviation for Fsus2, that would be notes F G C
     F3 nothing that i know of
     F4 you might occasionally see this as an abbreviation for Fsus4, that would be notes F Bb C
     F5 that would be a "power chord", notes F and C only
     F6 that would be notes F A C and D, optional to leave C out
     F7 that means "F dominant 7" which is notes F A C and Eb. optional to leave out C
     F8 i've never seen this used by anyone else, but i personally use it as a chord symbol for F and F (an octave apart)
     F9 that means "F dominant 9" which is notes F A C Eb and G. optional to leave out C. who knows, maybe even leave out A
     F13 that means "F dominant 13" which is notes F A C Eb and D, with likely also G included, and optionally leave out C. maybe even leave out A
     F10, F12, F14 i've never seen any of those used as chord symbols.
     F11 the reason i consider this a strange example is because i think given the pattern seen with F9 and F13, it seems that any number higher than 7 will mean Fdominant7 plus that extra note. so according to this pattern, F11 would have to include A, Eb, AND Bb. but it is commonly thought (and taught) that Bb is no good on F7 unless you get rid of the A. in which case it would be called F7sus4. However, one time i saw F11 in a book and they actually used it to represent Eb/F (which means Eb, G, Bb, with F in the bass.) in other words, F9sus4. I'm pretty sure if you write F11, it will be not clear whether it includes the A or not. I'm not sure if F11 is assumed to be shorthand for F7sus4. I don't think it's clear enough. If you actually want the A and the Bb, and the Eb, i would recommend saying F7add4. if you don't want the A, i would recommend saying F7sus4. F11 will be ambiguous on the question of whether to include the A, which is kind of an important question
